item.title: How to build a license plate recognition system
item.author: Unknown
item.description: As I'm learning about computer vision, I built a prototype of a license plate recognition system to get familiar with some of the tools and concepts used the field. This is a summary of how I built such as a system and how it works.

item.title: Implemeting Conway's Game of Life on a Microbit board using Rust
item.author: Unknown
item.description: As part of my experience learning embedded programming in Rust, I implemented Conway's Game of Life on a microbit-v2 board. This was a nice little project that helped me get familiar with different aspects of the microbit board support crate and more general aspects of embedded programming such as concurrency and interrupts.

item.title: Building a Python CLI application to manage my bookmarks
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Recently, I have started to highlight text in my Kobo ereader as I go through a book. Once I've created a few bookmarks, I would like to somehow import them to my computer, ideally in a format such as markdown (since I like to use Obsidian to organise my notes), so I built a small program do it.
